meanings.definition: To conduct an official financial examination of (a company or individual)
meanings.sent1: The accountant audited the company's financial records.
meanings.sent2: The IRS audited my tax return last year.
meanings.sent3: The detective audited the suspect's alibi and found inconsistencies.
meanings.sent4: Her keen eyes audited every detail of the report.
meanings.sent5: The auditor audited the accounts with precision and thoroughness.

meanings.definition: To attend (a class) informally, not for academic credit
meanings.sent1: I audited a pottery class just for fun.
meanings.sent2: She decided to audit the history lecture to learn more about ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent3: Audrey audited the cooking class and ended up baking a delicious cake.
meanings.sent4: He audited the yoga session and felt more relaxed afterwards.
meanings.sent5: Auditing the painting workshop was a great way to spend the afternoon.
